channel.title: Public Timers?
channel.description:
Okay... I am trying to make a few things for my Server and I am trying to make time limits for things. With that, I would like to know how to add timers that are ALWAYS going down if they are above 0. For example:
I make weapon specials. It is great! But, there's one problem. When people do their special 5 times, and their specialBar integer is 5, they have to log out for it to go back to 0 so they can use their specials again!
But alas! A public timer will do the job! While their specialBar integer is >= 1 it will go down by itself, without doing a command!
----
That's like I want. It may be confusing, but basically I want to be able to make timer's so that every little while, without the user doing anything, the int goes down.
Need more info on my question? Ask me, please, I want answers!

item.title: Public Timers?
item.dc:creator: @kevin5475845 kevin5475845
item.description:
@kevin5475845 wrote:

well if i do think right this is something i have done before…

you do got well public int specialBar?

then lets do this… this makes it go down 1 every 500 MS (½ second)

search for public boolean process

then under it add this…

if (specialBar > 0) { specialBar--; }

that makes it go down 1 each ½ second…
